docs.abstract: For his project on teenage pregnancy in Latin America, Christian Rodriguez looked at his own upbringing as the son of a single, teenage mother.
docs.snippet: For his project on teenage pregnancy in Latin America, Christian Rodriguez looked at his own upbringing as the son of a single, teenage mother.

docs.lead_paragraph: The video shows a woman climbing a stairwell, her belly visibly pregnant, as she offers suggestions: Make sure there are no security cameras. Be careful not to look down or you might regret it.

headline.main: Shocking Ads Ignite Debate About Abortion Ban in Chile
headline.print_headline: Shocking Ads Ignite Debate About Abortion Ban in Chile

docs.lead_paragraph: Karatantcheva was 15 when she reached the quarterfinals of the 2005 French Open, but soon after hit a low when she was suspended two years for doping.

headline.main: Sesil Karatantcheva, a Onetime Rising Star, Is Rising Again at Age 25

docs.abstract: Sesil Karatantcheva, who defeated Jelena Jankovic in her first-round match at French Open tennis tournament, is back on track following 2005 doping suspension.
docs.snippet: Karatantcheva was 15 when she reached the quarterfinals of the 2005 French Open, but soon after hit a low when she was suspended two years for doping.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court agreed with a lower court that a state law unconstitutionally burdens women by banning abortions after the 12th week of pregnancy if a doctor can detect a fetal heartbeat.

headline.main: Arkansas: Stringent Abortion Limit Struck Down
headline.print_headline: Arkansas: Stringent Abortion Limit Struck Down

docs.abstract: Federal appeals court strikes down Arkansas law banning abortions after 12th week of pregnancy if doctor can detect fetal heartbeat; ruling supports doctors' arguments that abortion restrictions be based on viability of fetus outside womb and not presence of heartbeat.
docs.snippet: A federal appeals court agreed with a lower court that a state law unconstitutionally burdens women by banning abortions after the 12th week of pregnancy if a doctor can detect a fetal heartbeat.

docs.lead_paragraph: Peruvian rape victims who have become pregnant have no legal option but to keep an unwanted pregnancy after Congress voted against a bill to legalise abortion in such cases, an issue that has divided ordinary Peruvians.

headline.main: Peru Lawmakers Reject Bill to Allow Pregnant Rape Victims an Abortion
headline.print_headline: Peru Lawmakers Reject Bill to Allow Pregnant Rape Victims an Abortion

docs.snippet: Peruvian rape victims who have become pregnant have no legal option but to keep an unwanted pregnancy after Congress voted against a bill to legalise abortion in such cases, an issue that has divided ordinary Peruvians.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court struck down a key abortion restriction in Arkansas on Wednesday, agreeing with a lower court judge that it was inappropriate to ban most abortions after the 12th week of pregnancy if a doctor can detect a fetal heartbeat.

headline.main: Abortion Ban Based on Heartbeat Rejected by Appeals Court
headline.print_headline: Abortion Ban Based on Heartbeat Rejected by Appeals Court

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court struck down a key abortion restriction in Arkansas on Wednesday, agreeing with a lower court judge that it was inappropriate to ban most abortions after the 12th week of pregnancy if a doctor can detect a fetal heartbeat.

docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday struck down an Arkansas law that banned abortion at 12 weeks of pregnancy, upholding a lower court's decision last year that had blocked the law.

headline.main: Appeals Court Strikes Down Arkansas 12-Week Abortion Ban
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Strikes Down Arkansas 12-Week Abortion Ban

docs.snippet: A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday struck down an Arkansas law that banned abortion at 12 weeks of pregnancy, upholding a lower court's decision last year that had blocked the law.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Burmese woman working in Thailand hired a man to sedate and smuggle her 3-month-old baby across the border to relatives in Myanmar, researchers said, describing a common "service" for desperate migrant mothers fearful of losing their jobs.

headline.main: Desperate Migrant Pays for Baby to Be Drugged, Smuggled to Myanmar: Researchers
headline.print_headline: Desperate Migrant Pays for Baby to Be Drugged, Smuggled to Myanmar: Researchers

docs.snippet: A Burmese woman working in Thailand hired a man to sedate and smuggle her 3-month-old baby across the border to relatives in Myanmar, researchers said, describing a common "service" for desperate migrant mothers fearful of losing their jobs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors caring for quadruplets born prematurely to a 65-year-old Berlin woman say the babies are still in intensive care, but have been gaining a little weight and are being given their mother's milk through feeding tubes.

headline.main: Quadruplets Born to 65-Year-Old Mom Still in Critical Phase
headline.print_headline: Quadruplets Born to 65-Year-Old Mom Still in Critical Phase

docs.snippet: Doctors caring for quadruplets born prematurely to a 65-year-old Berlin woman say the babies are still in intensive care, but have been gaining a little weight and are being given their mother's milk through feeding tubes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Though my grandmother was a fashion designer, I hate buying clothes, and I still wear outfits from high school — in the last century.

headline.main: Review: Online Stylists for the Shopping-Averse
headline.print_headline: Review: Online Stylists for the Shopping-Averse

docs.snippet: Though my grandmother was a fashion designer, I hate buying clothes, and I still wear outfits from high school — in the last century.
